means: [非正式用语] 被雇佣的人
Help Through Industry Retraining and Employment 帮助实现工业再训练和就业协会

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"租，租用"之意。
means: hire ： 多指短期租用。在英国一般指租用车、船。
lease ： 指按照租约租出或租用房屋、土地或其它不动产。
rent ： 在英国指较长时间租出或租入房屋、商店或土地；而在美国指长时间或短时期租用各种资产以及日用东西。
let ： 尤指出租房屋或地产等。
charter ： 指承租大型运输工具，如飞机、轮船、大客车以及火车等。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"雇用"之意。
means: hire ： 普通用词，常指短期或长期雇用某人从事某一特定工作或一次性的工作，含强调为薪金而工作的意味。
employ ： 正式用词，侧重受雇者虽为薪金而工作，但工作固定共享有相当尊严。
engage可与hire换用，特指雇用专业人员。

sentence.Network_en: Child car seats only cost about £10 a week to hire.
sentence.Network_cn: 儿童汽车坐椅一周的租金才10英镑。

sentence.Network_en: Hire of skis, boots and clothing, is all available.
sentence.Network_cn: 滑雪板、滑雪靴和滑雪服皆有出租。

sentence.Network_en: Hire someone with experience, someone who knows about real estate.
sentence.Network_cn: 雇佣有经验、了解房地产业的人。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hȳrian 'employ (someone) for wages', hȳr 'payment under contract for the use of something', of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch huren (verb), huur (noun)

entry.def: If you hire someone, you employ them or pay them to do a particular job for you.

example.ex: Sixteen of the contestants have hired lawyers and are suing the organisers...
example.tran: 有16名参赛者已经请了律师，正在起诉主办方。

example.ex: The rest of the staff have been hired on short-term contracts...
example.tran: 其余的工作人员签的是短期雇用合同。

entry.def: If you hire something, you pay money to the owner so that you can use it for a period of time.

example.ex: To hire a car you must produce a passport and a current driving licence...
example.tran: 租车须出示护照及有效驾照。

example.ex: Her hired car was found abandoned at Beachy Head.
example.tran: 她那辆租来的车被发现遗弃在比奇角。

entry.def: You use hire to refer to the activity or business of hiring something.

example.ex: They booked our hotel, and organised car hire...
example.tran: 他们为我们订好了旅馆并安排了租车事宜。

example.ex: Hire of skis, boots and clothing, is all available.
example.tran: 滑雪板、滑雪靴和滑雪服皆有出租。

entry.def: If something is for hire, it is available for you to hire.

example.ex: Fishing tackle is available for hire.

sentences.sentence: "They hired two new secretaries in the department"

Sentence.sentence: They can hire a gardener to do the work.
Hiring more campus police would cost money, possibly making our tuition go up again.
Have you hired any employees to work with you yet?
In Germany " she told me,"we have all the benefits,"but employers don't wan to hire us.

According to Blau and Kahn,Swedish-style paternal(父亲的)leave policies and flexible time arrangements pose a second threat to woman's progress:they make employers cautious about hiring woman for full-time positions at all.
Swedish employers are hesitant about hiring women for full-time positions because of the family-friendly policies

sentences.en: No ordinary families can afford to hire servants.
We hired a driver to take us on a tour of the city.
sentences.cn: 我们雇了一个司机带我们游览这个城市。

sentences.en: He had the hire of a car for a week.
He paid the carriage hire to the driver.
sentences.cn: 他把马车租金给了马车夫。

sentences.en: The day's hire for the car is ten dollars.
sentences.cn: 汽车每日的租金是十美元。

jushi.english: You can hire a bicycle, a car, or a horse in that park whenever you want to.
jushi.chinese: 不管在什么时候,你都可以在那公园里租用到自行车、汽车或马。

jushi.english: Foreigners visiting the city can hire the service of guide.
jushi.chinese: 游览该城市的外国游客可以雇用导游。
